intro: Macropeplus ligustrinus var. friburgensis, commonly known as the Friburgensis spurge, is a variant of the spurge plant native to specific regions in Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
